simpoppit.gameboard
Class GameGrid

java.lang.Object
  simpoppit.gameboard.GameGrid
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, GameConsts
public class GameGrid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, GameConsts

Title: GameGrid

Description: The GameGrid class encapsulates the functionality of the Poppit game board (not the game rules, just the board mechanics). For instance, this class well initialize a board to a starting configuration (populate with random balloons, etc). This class provides the means to pop a balloon, but does not offer any method to decide if a balloon can legitimately be popped. That functionality is the task of the GameInterface.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2005

Version:
1.0
Author:
Andrew W. Henry

GameGrid

private GameGrid(int aNumberOfColumns,
                 int aNumberOfRows,
                 boolean clone)
Creates a game grid of arbitrary size and populates it with a random distribution of balloons.

Parameters:
aNumberOfColumns - integer number of columns for this board (x-dimension)
aNumberOfRows - integer number of rows for this board (y-dimension)
clone - boolean flag to indicate if this is a clone of an existing board (if so the population step is skipped)

likeColoredNeighborChain

public java.util.ArrayList<Coord> likeColoredNeighborChain(Coord aBalloon)
Return a list of Coords representing the like-colored neighbors of a given balloon, combined with the like-colored neighbors of each of those balloons, such that ultimately all balloons of like color to the provided balloon that are recursively adjacent are included.

Parameters:
aBalloon - Coord of grid location of interest
Returns:
list of Coords of grid locations

Return the current grid as a list of Coords ordered by row. Basically, this method provides a Coord view of the current game grid for methods that like to operate on Coords.

list of Coords

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

centerColumn

private float centerColumn()
Return a value for the vertical bisector of the grid. This value may or may not correspond with a "real" column, depending on whether there are an odd or even number of columns in the grid.

Returns:
float

squeezeColumns

private void squeezeColumns()
Iterate over each column in the grid, normalizing each one vertically. That is, if balloons have been popped in the column leaving spaces, "float" lower balloons up to fill in the gaps.

squeezeColumn

private void squeezeColumn(int aColumn)
Given a column, normalize it to fill in spaces left by popping balloons.

Parameters:
aColumn - the x-coordinate of the column to be normalized

columnIsEmpty

private boolean columnIsEmpty(int aColumn)
Given a column, returns true if the column is empty, false otherwise.

Parameters:
aColumn - the x-coordinate of the column to be tested
Returns:
boolean

squeezeRows

private void squeezeRows()
Loop over the rows of the grid moving empty rows to the outside and clustering non-empty rows together, ideally in the middle of the grid.

squeezeRow

private boolean squeezeRow()
Iterate once over the rows of the grid checking for empty columns. If an empty column is found on the "center side" of a full column, swap it with the nearest outside column to migrate it out.

Returns:
boolean true if a column was swapped, false if nothing was done

swapColumns

private void swapColumns(int column1,
                         int column2)
Given two x-coordinates of columsn in the grid, swap the columns

Parameters:
column1 - x-coordinate of one of the columsn to swap
column2 - x-coordinate of the column to swap it with
